channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: New Trump website reveals how much money a Harris presidency could cost taxpayers
item.description: The Trump campaign released a website Tuesday tabulating how much in increased taxes residents in each state can expect to pay if the 2017 tax cuts expire next year.

item.title: WATCH: Vance says political rhetoric is getting too heated, will 'do his part' to tone down
item.description: Donald Trump's running mate J.D. Vance called for a reduction in heated political rhetoric a day after the former president was apparently targeted for assassination for the second time in as many months.

item.title: The Radical Norm at Elite Colleges
item.description: If Cornell’s Russell Rickford, a history professor, went elsewhere to ply his wares, he’d in all likelihood be replaced by someone with equally pernicious views.

item.title: Expect Big Changes To U.S. Health Policies After The Election
item.description: If current trends continue, the typical American family will spend 40 percent of its income on health care by 2030.

item.title: Gov Sanders hits campaign trail as top surrogate for Trump in key battleground state: 'Going full-speed ahead'
item.description: Arkansas Gov. Sarah Huckabee Sanders is ramping up her presence on the campaign trail to support former President Donald Trump and will be taking a more prominent role as a surrogate ahead of the election.

item.title: Pope Francis says both U.S. presidential candidates are 'against life,' urges vote for 'lesser evil'
item.description: Pope Francis laid into Donald Trump and Kamala Harris over the weekend, saying that neither U.S. presidential candidate is really pro-life.

item.title: Trading places, &c.
item.description: On protectionism, Donald Trump, Laura Loomer, Kamala Harris, Taylor Swift, James Earl Jones, and more.

item.title: Bomb Threats Used By Media To Excuse Second Trump Assassination Attempt Have No ‘Validity At All’
item.description: Republican Gov. Mike DeWine confirmed Monday that all 33 bomb threats were hoaxes.

item.title: UN ambassador criticizes Israeli military, calls for 'fundamental changes'
item.description: United States' Ambassador to the United Nations Linda Thomas-Greenfield told the UN Security Council on Monday that Israel has "no basis" for firing on UNRWA personnel

item.title: Radio Nikki: Haley launching a weekly SiriusXM radio talk show at least through January
item.description: Former Republican presidential candidate Nikki Haley is launching her own radio talk show next week on SiriusXM that's set to air once a week at least through the inauguration of a new president.

item.title: Defense ‘Prioritization’ Is Not Enough
item.description: Prioritizing among the many threats our nation faces is important. But we must also rebuild our declining military.

item.title: After Woke ‘Star Wars’ Release, Ubisoft Stock Hits 9-Year Low
item.description: Adding race and sex politics to ‘Star Wars: Outlaws’ and ‘Assassin’s Creed: Shadows’ has not gone well for game maker Ubisoft.

item.title: Haitian influx causing one major safety concern among Springfield residents
item.description: Longtime residents of Springfield, Ohio, expressed concerns for their safety, but some also argued the city has an opportunity to give migrants a better life in the U.S.

item.title: Ohio governor says troopers to guard Springfield schools amid 'unfounded' bomb threats
item.description: Ohio Gov. Mike DeWine announced Monday that he would be stationing state highway patrol troopers at Springfield schools amid a series of "unfounded" bomb threats, many coming from overseas actors wanting to stir political discord.

item.title: Republicans Should Go from Trump’s ‘Concepts’ to Plan on Health Care
item.description: When Republicans don’t advance their own health-care policies, big-government progressives are happy to fill the void.

item.title: If We Really Wanted Fewer School Shootings, We’d Work To End Divorce
item.description: I held my breath when details of the 14-year-old alleged Georgia school shooter’s home life began unfolding in the news. I was not surprised when I learned his parents were divorcing — a red flag for boys. And Colt Gray struggled under the pressure. He’d recently changed schools and lived with his dad while his mom had custody […]

item.title: Obama makes TikTok appearances to push for voter registration: report
item.description: Barack Obama partnered with a TikTok influencer for National Voter Registration Day in a bid to pull the lever among young Americans for Kamala Harris.

item.title: Judge rejects Mark Meadows' bid to move Arizona election case to federal court
item.description: A judge has rejected former Donald Trump presidential chief of staff Mark Meadows' bid to move his charges in Arizona's fake elector case to federal court, marking the second time he has failed in trying to get his charges moved out of state court.

item.title: Reagan, Thatcher, and Qaddafi
item.description: How I ended up on the wrong side of Qaddafi.

item.title: Constitution Day Reminds Us Equality Under The Law Is Fading In The West
item.description: In a constitutional America, there would be absolute protection of the people’s rights and equal justice under the law. That's not our reality today.
